text:
Previous versions (e.g. 1.2) would only display information such as...

compile: <<-- a target >>
   [delete] Could not find file <<STUFF>> to delete.  <-- trace output >
     [echo]    COMPILE .
     [echo]         TO <<MORE STUFF>>

...if the -verbose option was specified. Now it seems to come out in all cases, 
even if the -quiet option is given (with the stuff in chevrons added by me for 
the purpose of explanation/clarity).
creator: andrew.doddington@jpmorgan.com
umagesh@apache.org
text:
I am not able to reproduce it!  Would you be able to give your build.xml file,
the parameters you pass to ant when invoking it, and other relevant details?
When I am not in verbose mode, Ant does not specify the message you say it does.
Moreover, I think it is behaving consistently as documented.  So, while I wait
for more inputs from you for me to reproduce this bug, I am going to mark this 
as 'WORKSFORME'.
